title: [Large-Scale] Practical Course on Digital Library and Repository Construction

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational digital information management, understanding of data structures, and basic programming knowledge
context.additional_context: Practice-oriented course for in-service professionals. Learners use BYOD (Bring Your Own Device) for hands-on activities, with learning outcomes measured through project-based assessment

learning_goals: Explain the components of a digital library and standard metadata frameworks.
Design repository interoperability systems using the OAI-PMH protocol.
Implement digital resource search algorithms applying mathematics-based data structures (trees, graphs).
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
